skill.name: 2026-coach
skill.description: Executive coaching skill that helps you plan your 2026 using research-backed process goals. Guides you through discovery questions, creates outcome goals, converts them to daily behaviors, and sets up accountability systems. Use when you want to plan your year, set goals, or need a coach to help you stay focused.
skill.summary: Executive coaching skill that helps you plan your 2026 using research-backed process goals. Guides y...
skill.author: BayramAnnakov

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing no executable code. Only contains system prompts, documentation, and markdown templates. No file system access, network calls, environment variable reads, or code execution capabilities. Completely safe for publishing.

content.value_statement: Setting goals for 2026 often leads to frustration when outcome goals fail. This executive coaching skill uses the proven process goals methodology that research shows is 15x more effective. It guides you through structured discovery, converts vague aspirations into daily behaviors you control, and builds an accountability system that keeps you on track.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through 4 rounds of strategic discovery questions about current state, vision, strategy, and available time
Creates structured goal hierarchies from annual outcomes to quarterly milestones to daily behaviors
Converts outcome goals into daily process goals that are 100% within user control
Generates markdown files for annual plans, weekly tracking, and coaching context
Provides accountability prompts for weekly reviews and motivation during tactical anxiety or lack of urgency
Adapts questioning style based on available tools: structured questions for Claude Code, conversational for Claude.ai
limitations: Does not execute tasks or access external systems on behalf of users
Cannot track user progress automatically without user input to each session
Only creates markdown files when users explicitly request and specify the save location
Requires users to provide honest answers to discovery questions for effective planning

use_cases.title: Plan your startup year
use_cases.description: Define your 2026 north star, break it into quarterly milestones, and establish daily behaviors that drive traction.

use_cases.title: Strategic career planning
use_cases.description: Map out department goals, personal development targets, and the daily actions that build influence and deliver results.

use_cases.title: Build consistent habits
use_cases.description: Transform creative ambitions into reproducible daily routines with weekly check-ins and process goal tracking.

prompt_templates.title: Start coaching session
prompt_templates.prompt: Please act as my executive coach and help me plan my 2026 using the process goals methodology. Start by asking me about my current situation and goals.

prompt_templates.title: Convert my outcome goal
prompt_templates.prompt: My outcome goal for 2026 is [describe goal]. Help me convert this into daily process goals that I can control 100%.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly review session
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me do my weekly review. Did I hit my process goal targets? What worked? What did not work? What am I learning?

prompt_templates.title: Create tracking files
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on our coaching conversation, create my 2026_PLAN.md, COACHING_CONTEXT.md, and WEEK_01.md files using the templates.

output_examples.input: I want to grow my SaaS to $100K MRR by December 2026
output: Your annual outcome goal: $100K MRR by Dec 2026
Daily process goals (what you control): Send 20 outbound messages, 5 product experiments, 3 customer interviews per day
Q1 milestone: Reach $15K MRR with validated acquisition channel
Q2 milestone: Reach $35K MRR with scalable playbook
Q3 milestone: Reach $60K MRR with team support
Q4 milestone: Reach $100K MRR with optimized operations

best_practices: Complete the full discovery phase before setting goals. The skill needs to understand your constraints, available time, and current stage to create effective process goals.
Be honest about your time availability. Process goals must be achievable within your actual schedule, not an idealized version.
Use the COACHING_CONTEXT.md file in future AI sessions. This gives new conversations your full context without repeating the discovery phase.
anti_patterns: Setting process goals that depend on others. Process goals must be 100% within your control, like sending messages rather than getting replies.
Skipping the weekly review. Without regular reflection, you lose visibility into whether your process goals are driving real progress.
Using vague language in discovery. Be specific about your current situation, constraints, and what success actually looks like to you.

faq.question: Does this skill work with Claude Code and Claude.ai?
faq.answer: Yes. In Claude Code, it uses structured questions via AskUserQuestion. In Claude.ai, it asks conversational questions. Both deliver the same coaching methodology.

faq.question: How many process goals should I set?
faq.answer: Research suggests focusing on 3-5 daily process goals maximum. Each should be an activity you control 100% and can complete regardless of external factors.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill recommends pairing with ActivityWatch Analysis for tracking focus time. Your COACHING_CONTEXT.md file works with any AI assistant for ongoing coaching.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. It has no file access, network calls, or code execution. All planning data stays in your conversation or files you explicitly create.

faq.question: What if I miss my daily targets?
faq.answer: Missing process goals is data, not failure. Use weekly reviews to identify barriers and adjust goals. The skill helps you troubleshoot without judgment and refocus on controllable actions.

faq.question: How is this different from other goal-setting methods?
faq.answer: Most methods focus on outcome goals you cannot fully control. This skill uses the research-backed process goals approach (d=1.36 effect size) that focuses on daily behaviors for 15x better results.
